Who's been eliminated from the game?
🚨Warning: Spoilers ahead for Season 3 of "The Traitors" so far!
Murdered: Dorinda Medley
Banished: Wells Adams
Murdered: Chanel Ayan
Banished: Tony Vlachos
Murdered: Jeremy Collins
Banished: Bob the Drag Queen
Murdered: Robyn Dixon
Banished: Nikki Garcia
Murdered: Bob Harper
Banished: Wes Bergmann
Murdered: Derrick Levasseur
Banished: Rob "Boston Rob" Mariano
What is ‘The Traitors’?

On the reality game show — which has versions in the United Kingdom, Canada, Australia and more countries around the world — the Faithfuls and the Traitors compete together in missions to earn money for the group prize fund. In between missions, the Faithfuls try to determine the identity of the Traitors and vote to banish them at the Round Table. Meanwhile, the Traitors meet in secret at a turret every night to discuss which Faithful to “murder” and eliminate from the game. Every player is hoping to make it to the end and collect the cash prize.
Since launching in the U.S., “The Traitors” has become a phenomenon and constantly trended on social media platforms during its second season.

In Season 1, “Survivor” alum Cirie Fields successfully deceived the other contestants while playing alongside fellow celebrities and a group of reality television fans. She left the show as the sole winner of $250,000.

Last season, fans watched Traitors Dan Gheesling (“Big Brother”), Parvati Shallow (“Survivor”) and Phaedra Parks (“The Real Housewives of Atlanta”) fail to outlast the Faithfuls. “The Challenge” stars Chris “CT” Tamburello and Trishelle Cannatella were crowned the winners and split $208,100.
(Disclosure: Peacock is owned by NBCUniversal, TODAY’s parent company.)

title: ‘The Traitors’ eliminations: Who’s been murdered or banished from Season 3 so far?
summary: Find out who has been banished or murdered so far on Season 3 of "The Traitors."
story: (Warning: Spoilers ahead for Season 3 of “The Traitors”...)

Season 3 of “The Traitors” has finally arrived after months of anticipation, and it is exceeding expectations. The first part of the season has delivered plenty of twists and jaw-dropping moments as several cast members’ dreams of winning the $250,000 ended quickly.

The latest season premiered on Peacock Jan. 9 and introduced fans to the initial 21 cast members tasked with adding as much money to the prize pot while avoiding being banished or murdered by their fellow contestants. Among the cast, which TODAY exclusively announced in June, were “Big Brother” legends Danielle Reyes and Britney Haynes, deceptive “Survivor” winners Tony Vlachos and Jeremy Collins and reality television favorites Chrishell Stause and Gabby Windey.
After host Alan Cumming made his grand entrance on horseback and welcomed the cast to the show’s Scottish castle, the game immediately began.

“Survivor” star Rob "Boston Rob" Mariano, "The Challenge" vet Wes Bergmann and "Big Brother" Season 16 winner Derrick Levasseur later joined the game, leaving the others to question if another Traitor was added to the mix.

By the end of Episode 7, the Faithfuls' brief sense of relief after eliminating a second Traitor was abruptly cut short as Cumming revealed that the Traitors would soon commit a murder in person. A teaser for Episode 8 showed the remaining Traitors circling in on their next victim, adding more chaos to an already turbulent season.

So, who has been eliminated from Season 3 of "The Traitors" so far? Find out below. Then, check back every week as the episodes are released at 9 p.m. ET/ 6 p.m. PT each Thursday to see who else was booted from the show — and if they were a Faithful or Traitor.
‘The Traitors’ Season 3 eliminated contestants
Dorinda Medley

Dorinda Medley made a costly mistake in Episode 1 when she decided to sacrifice her safety in the mission to help the team complete the task. After her selfless act was unappreciated by the rest of the cast, The “Real Housewives of New York City” star bickered with British royal Lord Ivar Mountbatten and a few others, placing a target on her back. The Traitors pounced on the opportunity and decided to make her their first victim, killing her off in Episode 2.
Wells Adams

During Episode 2, at the first roundtable of Season 3, Wells Adams had the tables turned on him. He initially planned to call out “The Real Housewives of Potomac” star Robyn Dixon as a potential Traitor following an awkward interaction between them earlier. But, she proved to be more convincing and reflected the spotlight onto him instead. “The Bachelorette” alum was banished after receiving a majority of the votes. Before he left, he revealed that he was a Faithful.
Chanel Ayan

Chanel Ayan seemed, admittedly, unprepared for the duplicity she would face on “The Traitors.” Like Dorinda, she erroneously chose to get off the boat in Episode 1. Then, she struggled after Wells’ elimination as he was one of her closest friends and allies in the house. In Episode 3, the Traitors decided to murder another housewife to create more confusion in the castle. As “The Real Housewives of Dubai” star learned her fate, she became emotional and questioned how the Traitors could be so cruel.
Tony Vlachos

Tony Vlachos, a two-time “Survivor” winner, had his stint on Season 3 cut short after placing his trust in the wrong people. During the third mission, Bob Harper called out Tony for not volunteering to go first and risk his safety. Tony didn’t appreciate being put on blast and voiced his irritations during the car ride home. At the roundtable, Bob Harper learned Tony was upset with him and started to wonder if Tony was a Traitor. Although the “Survivor” star tried to prove his innocence, a majority of the cast voted him out in Episode 3. Before departing, a hurt Tony confirmed he was a Faithful and labeled fellow “Survivor” alum Rob Mariano a “sellout” for turning on him.
Jeremy Collins

Episode 4 began with the conclusion of a special task for the Traitors. They were required to meet in a secret room in the castle and scribe three names, either Faithfuls or Traitors, onto a hidden parchment, shortlisting them for murder. The Traitors selected "Survivor" winner Jeremy Collins, "Summer House" star Ciara Miller and retired professional wrestler Nikki Garcia. Each person then had to lie down in a coffin and await their fate. Although Jeremy offered to work with the Traitors if he was spared, they chose to murder him since he correctly suspected "Big Brother" star Danielle Reyes was a Traitor. In his final confessional, Jeremy became emotional as he spoke about not bringing home the prize pot to his family.
Bob the Drag Queen

Bob the Drag Queen's devilishly cunning run on Season 3 was cut short in Episode 4 when his fellow Traitors, particularly Rob, turned on him. Bob had been vocal throughout the season, trying to cast suspicion onto others and throw his adversaries off his scent. But when he suggested the group question if the three newcomers — Rob, Wes and Derrick — were possible Traitors, Rob took it as an opportunity stab the "RuPaul’s Drag Race" winner in the back. Rob convinced the group to banish Bob, stunning him. After being voted out, Rob stood before the cast and proudly confirmed he had lied and was a Traitor.
Robyn Dixon

After a roaring roundtable that resulted in one of their own being exposed, the remaining Traitors plotted in Episode 5 to murder someone who would draw suspicion away from them. They debated back and forth, with one Traitor failing to be heard. Ultimately, they decided that murdering Robyn Dixon would add to the confusion permeating throughout the castle. When "The Real Housewives of Potomac" star learned she had been eliminated, she said, "I knew it was coming because I am a threat to the Traitors." In her parting words, she advised the Traitors to "work harder" after losing Bob the Drag Queen.
Nikki Garcia

Nikki Garcia was living on borrowed time in the castle after the Traitors set up her inevitable downfall. After being selected as one of the three contestants to lie in the coffin in Episode 4, the rest of the contestants assumed that at least one cast member chosen was a Traitor. The former WWE star deflected suspicion at first, but in Episode 5, one of her closest allies, Chrishell Stause, started to doubt her. Chrishell voiced her concerns about Nikki during the roundtable, leading most of the group to vote her out. "The win for me is that I do get to go home to my son. The loss for all of you is that I'm a Faithful," Nikki said as she left.
Bob Harper

As Episode 6 began, the trust between the Traitors was at an all time low.  They met in the turret and discussed their "dysfunctional family" before listing their targets. They settled on Bob Harper, who was vocal at the most recent roundtable about who the Faithfuls couldn't trust. The three remaining Traitors labeled him as "the more imminent threat" and agreed to murder him. When "The Biggest Loser" trainer didn't show up for breakfast the next morning, the cast, excluding the Traitors, were stunned. After Bob H. read his letter from the Traitors, he said, "No f---ing way. I think the Traitors are playing a really ballsy game. They're very invincible right now because they are so hidden. I'm angry. I'm just angry over the train of thought of why I was murdered. I hate the Traitors."
Wes Bergmann

At the end of the Episode 6, Wes Bergmann planned to turn on Rob, but the "Survivor" winner beat him to it. Throughout the episode, Wes had been suggesting Rob's name to multiple people. When everyone arrived at the roundtable, Rob used Wes' scheming ways against him and pointed out that Wes pushed for Nikki to be banished. To defend himself, Wes warned that he would target anyone who voted against him. His tactic didn't work and pushed the Faithfuls in the opposite direction, making them vote to banish him. "The Challenge" star delivered one of his signature boastful speeches before he left, calling himself "one of the greatest reality competition players of all time." He added, "I don't care about any of you. You are all chess pieces on a board. And so to all those people that have died until I got to this circle right here, I have no idea who killed them because I'm a Faithful."
Derrick Levasseur

Derrick Levasseur took a chance during the roundtable in Episode 6 and voiced his theory about Rob being a traitor. The next episode, his boldness came back to bite him. When the Traitors met in secret at the beginning of Episode 7, they begrudgingly decided the "Big Brother" winner needed to go to help rebuild trust between them. As Derrick learned his fate, he was unsurprised. "I knew that after I called out Rob directly last night, and he chose to instead go at Wes, that he was not going to give me another roundtable, which I guess I have to take as a compliment," Derrick said. He proudly added, "I'm the most dangerous person in here for the Traitors, and they know it." He said he would have made the same move and that he was "honored" to have been a part of the season.
Rob 'Boston Rob' Mariano

Rob's smooth-talking and cunning ways could no longer save him by Episode 7. Before he departed, Derrick planted seeds to his fellow Faithfuls, cautioning them that Rob was a Traitor. At breakfast, Rob posed the theory that the Traitors had murdered Derrick to make the "Survivor" star look guilty. But "Vanderpump Rules" star Tom Sandoval was unconvinced and realized that it was the third time a Faithful was murdered after publicly going against Rob. So, Tom presented that evidence during the roundtable, hoping that others would jump on board. After everyone voted, Rob received a majority of votes — including two from his fellow Traitors — and was banished, ending his masterful run this season. "First of all, I just want to tell all of you that I have really enjoyed meeting you and playing this game with you. I've had a ton of fun," he said during his final speech. "I am, and always have been, from the very beginning, a Traitor."

title: Hailee Steinfeld and fiancé Josh Allen make their red carpet debut
summary: Buffalo Bills quarterback Josh Allen and actor Hailee Steinfeld have officially made their red carpet debut as a couple. Here's a timeline of their relationship.
story: Josh Allen and Hailee Steinfeld have made their red carpet debut as a couple, months after getting engaged.
The couple, who have been linked since 2023, posed on the red carpet together for the first time at the 14th annual NFL Honors held at Saenger Theatre on Feb. 6 in New Orleans.
The newly-engaged twosome color coordinated in black, with the actor showing off her stunning engagement ring.
The two got engaged in November, yet hadn't made a public appearance together.
Allen and Steinfeld became Instagram official on July 23, 2024, after the Buffalo Bills quarterback shared a carousel of photos featuring the Oscar-nominated actor.
Although that marked the first time the NFL star shared a photo with Steinfeld, they had popped up on social media together before.
Here’s what to know about the timeline of Steinfeld and Allen's romance.
May 2023: Hailee Steinfeld and Josh Allen are spotted out and about together
In May 2023, the actor and the NFL player were seen hanging out together around New York City in various photos shared by the New York Post and People, sparking romance rumors.
The same month, the pair reportedly were also photographed at a New York City sushi restaurant, Sushi By Bou.
August 2023: Josh Allen appears to address the relationship rumors publicly
Allen seemed to indirectly address his rumored relationship with Steinfeld in an Aug. 2, 2023 interview on the “Pardon My Take” podcast.
Co-host Dan Katz teased Allen about the romance rumors, working  in a reference to Steinfeld by “accidentally” mispronouncing the name of a classic ‘90s sitcom.
“Are you a fan of Steinfeld?” Katz asked the NFL star.
Allen wasn’t taking the bait.
“I don’t know what 'Steinfeld' is,” he deadpanned back. “The show? Big fan.”
But a moment later, Allen acknowledged Katz's accidentally-on-purpose “Steinfeld” slip-up.
“I didn’t know how I was going to work that in,” Katz said of his playful flub. “Did I do a good job?”
“You did a good job,” Allen said. “Respect. Respect.”
Shortly afterward, the quarterback talked about having a girlfriend, though he never mentioned Steinfeld by name.
The topic came up when co-host Eric Sollenberger (aka PFT Commenter) asked Allen if he had seen the recent news about his rumored relationship.

“There was a headline and it was just, ‘Josh Allen Makes Out With His Girlfriend on Vacation,’” Sollenberger said. “That’s awesome, that somebody writes an article about you making out with your girlfriend.”
“The fact that anybody cares about that still blows my mind,” Allen replied.
He added that it has been tough dealing with paparazzi attention.

“They were on a boat,” he said, referring to photographers he encountered on vacation. “I saw it and I just like, I just felt like this gross feeling. Insecurity, no privacy, just like, what is wrong with you?”
September 2023: Hailee Steinfeld attends Buffalo Bills game and shops with Josh Allen's mother
Steinfeld appeared to attend the Buffalo Bills game in September 2023 at Highmark Stadium in Orchard Park, New York.
On X fans shared a photo on social media of a woman whom they identified as Steinfeld.
In the photo, the woman who fans believe is Steinfeld wore a red baseball cap and a tan hoodie as Allen led the Bills to a 38-10 victory over the Las Vegas Raiders.
On Sept. 30, 2023, the shop Leveled Up Buffalo, located in East Aurora, New York, shared a picture on Instagram of Steinfeld shopping alongside Allen’s mom, Lavonne Allen.
The photo, which also included store owner Lindsey Vega, showed the three women smiling together, featuring two shopping bags. The store captioned the post, “Pinch me.”
January 2024: Hailee Steinfeld is asked about a ‘football boy’

Steinfeld attended the Golden Globe Awards on Jan. 7, 2024 and was asked on the red carpet about the internet's obsession with "Hollywood girls loving the football boys," seemingly alluding to Steinfeld and Taylor Swift, who is dating Kansas City Chiefs star Travis Kelce.
Steinfeld remained silent but gave the “E! News” host an eyebrow-raise and a smirk.
“What is it about a sportsy man?” the host asked.
“Listen, what isn’t it about, come on now,” Steinfeld replied.

A couple weeks later, Steinfeld, who appeared in Swift’s 2015 music video for “Bad Blood,” attended the Bills' playoff game against the Kansas City Chiefs on Jan. 21, which created the potential for a reunion between her and Swift, who also attended the game.
But alas, the two friends were not photographed together at the game, which the Chiefs won the game 27 — 24.
March 2024: Hailee Steinfeld joins Josh Allen at a gender reveal party for his sister's baby-on-the-way
Steinfeld was right by Allen's side at a gender reveal party for his sister Nicala Madden's baby-on-the-way.

Madden posted a TikTok video on March 24 that showed Allen standing with his hand on Steinfeld's back as the pair correctly guessed that his sister's second child with husband Brayden Madden will be another boy.
July 2024: Josh Allen shares photos of Hailee Steinfeld on Instagram
Allen posted the photos fans have been waiting for when she shared pictures of himself with Steinfeld on Instagram, including snaps from Paris and large gatherings.

In the first picture in his slideshow, the couple stared at the Eiffel Tower, which sparkled at night behind them. It seems the photo was taken a few months ago as Steinfeld previously shared a picture of her wearing the same outfit in Paris on April 4, 2024.
November 2024: Josh Allen and Hailee Steinfeld get engaged
The couple took their relationship to the next level when they announced their engagement in a joint Instagram post.
“11•22•24,” reads the post, which also included an infinity sign emoji.
In the photo, the athlete is seen down on one knee while Steinfeld rests her forehead on his. The couple is outside and surrounded by candles on a green lawn as they stand in front of a floral arch.
February 2025: Josh Allen and Hailee Steinfeld make their red carpet debut

It only took a couple months after their engagement for the twosome to make their red carpet debut. Allen and Steinfeld color coordinated in black to attend the 14th annual NFL Honors in New Orleans on Feb. 6, 2025, ahead of the Super Bowl.

title: Who is Bill Belichick’s 24-year-old girlfriend? All about Jordon Hudson
summary: Bill Belichick and his girlfriend, Jordon Hudson, are red carpet official. Here's everything we know about 24-year-old Jordon Hudson.
story: Bill Belichick and his girlfriend, Jordon Hudson, continue to step into the spotlight together.
Ahead of the 2025 Super Bowl, the former Patriots coach, 72, and Hudson, 24, attended the 14th annual NFL Honors at Saenger Theatre in New Orleans on Feb. 6.
The couple posed for photos on the red carpet before the event. Belichick was all smiles in a red suit jacket with black slacks, while Hudson wore a silver cut-out dress.
Belichick and Hudson have been linked for several months now. The pair made their first formal public appearance at the Museum of Natural History's 2024 Museum Gala on Dec. 5.
They've also taken to social media to showcase their relationship with fun photos and trips.
Belichick and his former partner of 16 years, Linda Holliday, split last year, People reported in September 2023.

The NFL coach was also previously married to Debby Clarke from 1977 to 2006, and they share three children, all of whom are coaches themselves: Amanda Belichick, the head lacrosse at Holy Cross Athletics, Stephen Belichick, the defensive coordinator for the University of Washington, and Brian Belichick, the safeties coach for the New England Patriots.
Keep reading to learn more about Bill Belichick’s girlfriend, Jordon Hudson.
She was a cheerleader at Bridgewater State University
Hudson was a cheerleader during her time at Bridgewater State University, becoming an NCA Collegiate Champion in 2021, according to her Instagram profile.
She attended BSU from 2019 to 2022, graduating with a B.A. in philosophy, according to her LinkedIn profile.
Hudson continued cheering after graduation, joining the East Celebrity Elite cheer squad.
She opened up about what cheerleading means to her in a February Instagram post after her team made the world championships.

“I’d like to put out how grateful I am for the sport that kept me anchored through difficult seasons of adolescence and young adulthood, engrained resilience, discipline, and punctuality into my bones … and brought me lifelong friends,” she captioned a photo of herself with her team.
She also shared her gratitude for the medical professionals, coaches and peers who “aided in neurological damage rehabilitation.”
“Without y’all’s support, I wouldn’t have been able to ‘un-retire’ and be back on the mat to finish out the dream,” she wrote.
Jordon Hudson is a former a beauty pageant contestant and model
Hudson was the first runner-up in the 2024 Miss Maine USA pageant in March.
She shared an Instagram photo of herself at the Miss Maine pageant earlier this year wearing her sash representing Hancock, Maine.
"Miss Hancock USA is in the building!! Let's do this thang!!!" she wrote in the caption.
Hudson also worked previously as a social media ambassador and model for Rebel Athletic, a luxury performance athletic wear brand.
“To be a Rebel means to be true to yourself, to embrace your inner sparkle. I am proud to stand behind them and be apart (sic) of the #Rebel movement,” Hudson wrote on Instagram in 2020.
She is a self-described entrepreneur
Hudson describes herself as an entrepreneur in her Instagram profile.
According to her LinkedIn page, she has been the executive director of the Boston-based Trouble Cub Enterprises since April 2021.

The company’s website is currently password protected, but an earlier version of the page describes Trouble Cub Enterprises as the parent company of TCE Investments, which specializes in financial literacy education, beauty consulting and beauty contracting.
Jordon Hudson graduated from cosmetology school
Hudson shared on Instagram in 2019 that she had graduated from The New England Hair Academy, a cosmetology school in Malden, Massachusetts.

“I am so exhaustingly excited to announce, that I am OFFICIALLY a graduate of The New England Hair Academy. Last step is licensure (which is a piece of cake.) This chapter may be over, but the show goes on,” she wrote in the caption.

She called the experience an “intense chapter” of her life, and said she balanced her cosmetology training with her schoolwork during her final year of high school, and continued the program while in college.

While attending college and the cosmetology academy, she says she also worked as a henna tattoo artist, became a college cheerleader, modeled for Rebel Athletics, and toured New England with cheerleader and WWE star Gabi Butler.
Jordon Hudson has posted about Bill Belichick on social media
While they only just made their red carpet debut, Hudson and Belichick have made a few appearances together on social media in recent months.
In September, Hudson shared an Instagram photo of her and Belichick petting a goat at the Navy-Marine Corps Memorial Stadium in Annapolis, Maryland.
She also welcomed Belichick to Instagram after he joined the platform that month.
“This is my formal petition for @BillBelichick to change his handle to @ BillyGoat !! 🐐 Welcome to the ‘Gram, Billy!!!!” she wrote in the caption.
She also included Belichick in a roundup of photos from summer 2024, which she shared on Instagram in October.
In one selfie, the pair appears to be standing in front of a lighthouse at sunset. In another picture, Belichick poses with his arm around Hudson.
The couple were also spotted together at a corn maze at West End Creamery in Whitinsville, Massachusetts, in October.
Later that month, the couple revealed their coordinated Halloween costumes.
Hudson dressed up as a mermaid and lay on the beach as Belichick, dressed as a fisherman, pretended to reel her in.
"Ouucchhhh!!!" Hudson wrote in the caption, adding a fish hook emoji.
"My biggest catch!!!" Belichick wrote in the comments.
A New Orleans tourism site also shared a video of Belichick and Hudson walking in the city's French Quarter in January 2023, though it's unclear whether the two were dating at the time.
She responded to jokes about her and Bill Belichick’s relationship during 'The Roast of Tom Brady'
Hudson and Belichick’s relationship came up during Netflix’s “The Roast of Tom Brady” in March.
While not mentioning Hudson by name, Rob Gronkowski teased his former coach about his relationship with a much younger woman.
Hudson had a playful response to the roast in a November Instagram post.
“Happy 6 Month Roast-iversary 🔥🐐,” she wrote in the caption. “Hopefully y’all’s burn wounds healed over... I know Bill & I are still applying bacitracin daily.”
Jordon Hudson and Bill Belichick attend their first formal public event as a couple
The pair stepped out together at the Museum of Natural History’s 2024 Museum Gala in New York City on Dec. 5, marking the first time they have appeared as a couple at a formal public event.
They coordinated in black for their debut appearance, with Belichick wearing a traditional tuxedo and Hudson sporting an off-the-shoulder black gown with silver embellishments around the leg.
CORRECTION (Dec. 12, 2024, 10:30 a.m. ET): An earlier version of this article misspelled Jordon Hudson’s first name. It’s Jordon, not Jordan.

title: Did ‘Sweet Magnolias’ Season 4 just kill off a major character?
summary: Tragedy strikes the small town of Serenity in Season 4 of "Sweet Magnolias" when a main character is killed off. After Maddie and Cal's (JoAnna Garcia Swisher and Justin Bruening) surprise wedding in the season premiere, the vibe instantly shifts at the end of Episode 2 when Maddie's former mother-in-law Bonnie Townsend (Judith Ivey) shows up to her house unannounced to share some somber news: Bill (Chris Klein) has died.
story: Tragedy strikes the small town of Serenity in Season 4 of "Sweet Magnolias" when a main character is killed off.

After Maddie and Cal's (JoAnna Garcia Swisher and Justin Bruening) surprise wedding in the season premiere, the vibe instantly shifts at the end of Episode 2 when Maddie's former mother-in-law Bonnie Townsend (Judith Ivey) shows up to her house unannounced to share some somber news: Bill (Chris Klein) has died.

Bill has been a main character in the series since Season 1, when his affair with his nurse Noreen (Jamie Lynn Spears) resulted in an unexpected pregnancy and wreaked havoc on his marriage with Maddie.
Bill's infidelity led to the end of his marriage with Maddie and troubled relationships with his three children, especially his sons Ty (Carson Rowland) and Kyle (Logan Allen).

Although he's caused plenty of strife for his family and friends over the years, Bill's death sends shockwaves through the town. Below, we're breaking down everything you need to know about his surprising departure from the show.
How does Bill die in 'Sweet Magnolias' Season 4?
In Episode 3, Bonnie tells Maddie that Bill died of a "mercifully quick" heart attack.
How does Bill's death affect the residents of Serenity?

When viewers last heard from Bill, he was leaving town with Kathy (Wynn Everett) at the end of Season 3. As Bonnie explains, Kathy has been "such a blessing" in Bill's family's life since the two started dating and moved back to his home state of Texas.
When Kathy informs Bonnie that Bill wanted to be buried in Serenity, the matriarch returns to town to "sort this nonsense out" and ensure that he is buried in Texas with the rest of his family.

Maddie regretfully informs Bonnie that she and Bill had previously decided to be buried in Serenity. While speaking with a lawyer later on, Bonnie realizes she can't contest her son's wishes without a steep uphill battle, especially since he prepared a letter with his lawyer regarding the matter four months ago (after he moved back to Texas).

Bonnie invites herself to stay with Maddie and her children, taking  over Bill's childhood bedroom. With the help of her two best friends Helen (Heather Headley) and Dana Sue (Brooke Elliott), Maddie informs everyone about Bill's death, including her children.

Ty, Kyle and Katie (Ella Grace Helton) are understandably shocked by their father's sudden death, but express a desire to return to work and school. Bonnie scoffs at Maddie's decision to allow the children to pick up their normal schedules, but Maddie's mother steps in and nips Bonnie's criticism in the bud.
Maddie breaks the news about Bill's death to Noreen, who is nervous about finally meeting Bonnie, who's always gotten the sense that Bill's mother sees her as a "harlot." Maddie vows to support her.

At home with Isaac (Chris Medlin), Noreen says she's sad her daughter won't have the choice of having a relationship with her father. Isaac, who recently found out Bill was his biological father, also looks sad as she talks — but doesn't tell Noreen Bill was his father.

During a dinner in Bill's honor, Noreen snaps at Bonnie when Bill's mother makes a comment about grieving properly. When Isaac enters the rooms, Bonnie inadvertently announces that he's Bill's son, much to everyone's surprise, except for Maddie, who has known for a while. The announcement leads to a rift between Noreen and Isaac, who later patch things up.

Bonnie creates plenty of chaos while she's in town, clashing with Maddie, Noreen and even Ty at one point. But Kathy surprises everyone and helps maintain the peace. When she leaves Serenity with Bill's parents, Kathy leaves Christmas presents that Bill had meant to give his children, including Isaac and Noreen's daughter Rebecca Lynne “Bex.”

Over time, Maddie and Bill's children adjust to the idea of having Isaac as a new sibling and embrace him with open arms. Although, their newfound bond doesn't come without a few awkward moments along the way.
How are fans reacting to the news of Bill's death?
It didn't take long for "Sweet Magnolias" fans to start commenting on Bill's death after Season 4 premiered on Feb. 6.
Some viewers said they had a feeling something was going on with his character.
“I knew they were gonna kill Bill off when I didn’t see him in the trailer and only showed a dang funeral,” one X user wrote.
At the same time, some viewers were totally shocked.
“Wait what They killed off Bill? I did not see that one coming,” another X user commented.
Many fans had mixed reactions, especially since Bill's character was someone they loved to hate.
"As much as I hated Bill, why did they kill him off the show?!?! I’m so shocked!!" one wrote.
What has showrunner Sheryl Anderson said about Bill's death?
"Sweet Magnolias" showrunner Sheryl Anderson spoke with Glamour about the shocking plot twist in a new interview and explained the decision to kill off Bill's character.

"We love Chris, and Chris loves the show, so it was really, really hard to say, 'Hey, Chris, we want to take the show in a different direction, and we need this cataclysmic event to shake up everybody,'" she explained.
Per Anderson, Bill's death is the catalyst for the show's adults, "especially our men" to "question what they're doing with their lives."

"That theme of tomorrow isn’t promised. You get to a certain age, and when a friend of yours, who’s your age, dies, it’s always too soon, but especially when you are that age. You realize time isn’t on our side and think, 'Am I doing what I want to do? Am I with the person I want to be with? What other changes do I need to make in my life?'" she explained.
Anderson said Klein "understood and took one for the team" when he heard the news.

title: Sarah Michelle Gellar confirms ‘Buffy the Vampire Slayer’ reboot is in the works: ‘This will be for you’
summary: Sarah Michelle Gellar confirmed reports that she is working on a reboot of her hits show "Buffy the Vampire Slayer."
story: Sarah Michelle Gellar is officially ready to return to Sunnydale.
After reports circulated that a “Buffy the Vampire Slayer” reboot was in the works with the actor returning, Gellar confirmed to fans on Instagram that she is involved in a revival of the show.

“So….. you might have heard some news this week, but I realize you haven’t heard from me,” Gellar, 47, wrote on Feb. 6, alongside a photo of herself as Buffy and the character's memorable quote, “If the apocalypse comes, beep me.”

Gellar went on to share details about why she decided to return to her slayer days, almost 22 years since the show ended. It all started three years ago with a phone call from her “dear friend and mentor,” producer and executive Gail Berman.

"She told me that she wanted me to sit down with Chloé Zhao to hear her take on a potential ‘Buffy’ revival,” Gellar wrote. “I was blown away that Chloé even knew who I was, but, as I’ve always done, I told Gail that I just didn’t see a way for the show to exist again.”
However, Gellar explained how this time it was different and she agreed to go meet with the “Nomadland” director, “mainly just to meet Chloé.”

“And our twenty minute coffee quickly turned into a four hour adventure. We laughed, we cried, but mostly we both talked about how much this show means to us,” she wrote, adding that at the time she didn’t agree to continuing Buffy’s story.

But she did “shock” herself by agreeing to continue the conversation. “These conversations did, in fact, continue over the next few years and eventually we added the incredible Nora and Lilla Zuckerman to our little tribe until ultimately, one day, we landed on an idea.”
Gellar wrote that she has always listened to the fans and heard their desires to revisit “Buffy” and her world.

“But it was not something I could do unless I was sure we would get it right. This has been a long process, and it’s not over yet,” she wrote. “I promise you, we will only make this show if we know we can do it right. And I will tell you that we are on the path there.”

She added that she feels so lucky to be on this journey with the “four unbelievably talented women, all of whom love ‘Buffy’ as much as I do. And as much as you do. Thank you to all the fans who never stopped asking for this. This will be for you.”
“Buffy the Vampire Slayer” premiered on The WB on March 10, 1997. It ran for seven seasons, airing its finale episode on May 20, 2003, on UPN.
The series followed California teenager Buffy Summers, the “Chosen One” foretold to defeat evil beings in her town of Sunnydale — and eventually the world.
Several outlets reported Feb. 3 that a “Buffy” reboot was close to receiving a pilot order at Hulu. TODAY.com has reached out to Gellar and Hulu for comment.
Back in December while on “The Drew Barrymore Show,” Gellar said she might be up for the idea of picking up Mister Pointy again (Buffy’s favorite stake).

“It’s funny. I always used to say no, because (‘Buffy’) is in its bubble and it’s so perfect,” Gellar said. “But watching ‘Sex and the City’ and seeing ‘Dexter,’ and realizing there are ways to do it, definitely does get your mind thinking, ‘Well, maybe.’”

title: Ginna Dix, wife of 'Maine Cabin Masters' star Matt 'Dixie' Dix, dies unexpectedly at 48
summary: Ginna Dix, who was married to Matt "Dixie" Dix from "Maine Cabin Masters," has died.
story: Ginna Dix, wife of "Maine Cabin Masters" star Matt “Dixie” Dix, has died at age 48.
The Magnolia Network show announced Ginna Dix's death Feb. 5 on Instagram alongside images of her as a child and others of her and her husband over the years.

"We are heartbroken to announce the unexpected passing of Ginna Dix on February 1, 2025," the announcement read. "Beloved wife of Dixie, God Daughter to Ryan’s parents, and friend to so many. Ginna was a huge part of the Maine Cabin Masters family and will be missed tremendously,:
The message concluded with a thanks to viewers for their "love and support" along with a plea to "give the Maine Cabin Masters team privacy at this time."

An obituary for Ginna Dix published by centralmaine.com on Feb. 4 revealed that she died unexpectedly at Maine Medical Center in Portland, Maine, with family members by her side. It did not provide a cause a death.
Ginna Dix and Dixie Dix met in 2000, the same year she earned a bachelors degree in nursing, and wed the following year, according to her obit.
After working as a registered nurse in Maine for many years, Ginna Dix earned a Master of Science in nursing from Purdue University in January of 2018 to become a nurse practitioner.
Ginna Dix's obituary also noted that she loved spending time with her husband and the couple's three dogs, Quimby, Dodge and Asher.

"Ginna found joy in spending time at the beach in the summer and snowmobiling through the woods in the winter," the obit read. "She was happiest when she was 'up to camp' surrounded by her family and friends, listening to music and drinking a glass of Prosecco on Saturday mornings. She was often found sitting quietly on the couch with her dogs, a strong cup of coffee and reading a book.”
Dixie Dix's "Maine Cabin Masters" co-star Ryan Eldridge, a lifelong friend of the couple, honored Ginna Dix in a Feb. 5 Instagram tribute.

“We were born on the same day two years apart, our parents were best friends, you married my best friend,” Eldridge wrote alongside a throwback photo of the trio and another showing him and Ginna Dix when they were younger.
Eldridge recalled Ginna Dix being "one of the boys," when she was a young, "riding around inside the house on bicycles on Iron Mine Hill," who grew up to be a "powerful, no nonsense women (sic)."

"I will never forget that time I whacked you with a tennis racket, you calmly gave me a look that I’ll never forget as you weren’t phased and knew I was screwed as you calmly walked back to tell our parents," he recalled.
He also remembered being present "the night you and Matty locked eyes and were dancing on the countertops."
He added, "You have been a big part of my life since day one and left this world way too soon, but you sure did make a mark in your short time. I love you Gin!"

title: Everything to know about the ‘Saturday Night Live’ 50th anniversary special
summary: When is the “Saturday Night Live” 50th anniversary special? Who is cast as the host? Who is returning? Find out here.
story: “Saturday Night Live” is reuniting with some fan-favorite celebrity hosts for its upcoming 50th anniversary special.

This year, the NBC live sketch comedy series, which debuted in October 1975, is celebrating its 50th anniversary. To commemorate the historic moment, NBC will soon air a live three-hour show, honoring “SNL” and the long-running show’s ability to keep fans laughing for half a century.
So far, “SNL” creator and producer Lorne Michaels and the current cast have been fairly tight-lipped when it comes to sharing details about the tribute episode.
But on Feb. 6, NBC revealed a few famous faces who will be featured in the special.

Among the names are “Five-Time’s Club” members — stars who have served as a host at least five times — Steve Martin and Tom Hanks, as well as former hosts and music guests, like Dave Chappelle, Kim Kardashian and Sabrina Carpenter.
Read on to find out who else will make an appearance and everything to know about the 50th anniversary “SNL” special, below.
When is the ‘SNL’ 50th anniversary special?

“SNL” will mark its 50th anniversary with a celebratory weekend that culminates in a live three-hour primetime special airing Sunday, Feb. 16, 2025, from 8 to 11 p.m. ET, NBC previously announced in a release.
Who will host the celebration?

On Feb. 6, “SNL” uploaded a video to its social media pages teasing a few of the celebrities who will participate in the anniversary special. The following names popped up in the clip and more are expected to be announced leading up to the live episode:

Adam DriverAyo EdebiriBad BunnyDave ChappelleJohn MulaneyKim KardashianMartin ShortMiley CyrusPaul McCartneyPaul SimonPedro PascalPeyton ManningQuinta BrunsonRobert De NiroSabrina CarpenterScarlett JohanssonSteve MartinTom HanksWoody Harrelson

What has been said about the 50th anniversary show?
“SNL” comedian Mikey Day stopped by TODAY all the way back in June 2023 and dropped a couple hints as to what fans can expect from the hours-long special.
“Oh my gosh, it’s going to be insane,” Day told TODAY co-hosts Hoda Kotb and Jenna Bush Hager. “I haven’t heard that much. I know Lorne’s slowly putting it together.”
He continued, “I believe every famous person in the universe will be there. It’s wild.”

During a red carpet interview at the 2023 Emmys, Entertainment Weekly asked Michaels who he could see succeeding him when he’s ready to retire, to which the “SNL” creator spoke about the 50th anniversary.

“We’re doing the 50th anniversary show in February of ’25, so I will definitely be there for that, and definitely be there until that, and sometime before that we’ll figure out what we’re going to do,” he said at the time.

title: How the ending of 'Sweet Magnolias' sets up Season 5
summary: Netflix fans are holding out hope that "Sweet Magnolias" will return for another season. If so, here is how a Season 5 could look like.
story: Feeling dizzy after binge-watching Season 4 of “Sweet Magnolias”? It's a whirlwind, we know.
The hit Netflix series debuted its fourth season on Feb. 6 and fans were instantly buzzing over Maddie's big career move, Bill's shocking death, and Helen and Erik's romantic proposal.
Naturally, viewers were left hungry for more action from the residents of Serenity.
Wondering if “Sweet Magnolias” is returning for another season? We’re sharing everything you need to know.
Has 'Sweet Magnolias' been renewed for Season 5?

Not yet, but that’s typical for Netflix. The streaming service announced that “Sweet Magnolias” was returning for Season 4 a few months after Season 3 debuted, so it’s likely that viewers will get some answers in the near future.
When would Season 5 of 'Sweet Magnolias' premiere?
There was almost a two-year break between the third and fourth seasons of “Sweet Magnolias,” but the 2023 Hollywood strikes involving SAG-AFTRA and WGA were likely a factor in the delay.

Season 4 was in production between February and May 2024 and premiered eight months later. If the show is renewed for Season 5 in the first few months of 2025, it's likely that viewers won't see another season for at least another year when you factor in writing, filming and post-production.
How did Season 4 of 'Sweet Magnolias' end?
Change was afoot at the end of “Sweet Magnolias” Season 4.

Maddie found herself at a crossroads as she prepared to embark on a new career in New York City and leave behind Serenity. Meanwhile, Helen and Erik (Dion Johnstone) were basking in the bliss of their post-engagement glow and Dana Sue and Ronnie (Brandon Quinn) took the first steps toward exploring a new business opportunity.
Romance was in the air for Noreen (Jamie Lynn Spears) after Jeremy (Chase Anderson) invited her and her daughter to move in with him. Isaac (Chris Medlin) also had a new love interest.
Annie (Anneliese Judge) and Ty’s (Carson Rowland) budding relationship hit a snag when Annie got accepted into art school in California and he was set to go on tour in Europe.
What could happen in Season 5 of 'Sweet Magnolias'?

If “Sweet Magnolias” fans are lucky enough to see a fifth season of the series, the next installment of episodes would likely explore Maddie’s new life in New York City (if she actually does decide to move forward with the new job). Wedding bells would likely be in the air for Helen and Erik, making that a focal point of a potential next season.

Of course, diehard fans are also eager to see what happens to Annie and Ty’s relationship. A fifth season would likely follow them as they both pursue their passions on separate continents and decide if they can make their relationship work.

title: Taylor Swift and Brittany Mahomes’ friendship timeline
summary: Here's what to know about Taylor Swift and Brittany Mahomes' friendship, from their time together in Europe to cheering on the NFL sidelines.
story: Taylor Swift and Brittany Mahomes have developed a sweet friendship through their shared love of the Kansas City Chiefs.

Swift, the girlfriend of tight end Travis Kelce, and Mahomes, the wife of quarterback Patrick Mahomes, have been photographed together at games — complete with a celebratory BFF handshake — as well as out to dinner and at events.
Patrick and Brittany Mahomes also attended one of Swift's "Eras Tour" concerts with Kelce in Amsterdam in 2024.

Back in November 2023, Brittany Mahomes made her friendship with Swift Instagram official when she posted a photo of herself posing with Swift, Lyndsay Bell, wife of former Chiefs tight end Blake Bell, and Paige Buechele, who’s the wife of former Chiefs backup quarterback Shane Buechele.
Since then, their friendship has included nights out on both coasts and mutual support, both online and in real life. Here's a timeline of their friendship so far.
September 2023: Brittany Mahomes and Taylor Swift are first spotted together
Swift first sent Chiefs and NFL fans into a frenzy when she attended the Chiefs’ win over the Chicago Bears on Sept. 24, 2023.
Not long after, Swift and Mahomes were spotted out to dinner together in New York City as they got acquainted.

It also marked the beginning of Mahomes being absorbed into a group of Swift’s friends, which also includes Selena Gomez, Zoë Kravitz, Blake Lively, Sophie Turner, the Haim sisters and producer Jack Antonoff.
Oct. 1, 2023: Brittany Mahomes and Taylor Swift are first seen at a game together

The duo were first spotted at a game together when the Chiefs played against the New York Jets on Oct. 1. In addition to Mahomes, Swift was also seen with Lively, Turner, Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman that night.
Then, during the Chiefs 19-8 victory against the Denver Broncos at Arrowhead Stadium Oct. 12, 2023, the “Blank Space” singer and Mahomes also popped up on the broadcast celebrating together.
They were seen hugging during the first half and later celebrating a touchdown. Kelce also had a big game, with Patrick Mahomes finding him for nine catches for 124 yards in the victory.
Oct. 22, 2023: They debuted a handshake
The two were seen celebrating in style after a touchdown during the Kansas City Chiefs' 31-17 win over the Los Angeles Chargers at Arrowhead Stadium on Oct. 22, 2023.

Following a 46-yard touchdown pass from Patrick Mahomes to wide receiver Marquez Valdes-Scantling in the second quarter, Swift and the wife of the quarterback broke out a new handshake in a scene shown on the broadcast.
They started with two slaps with the front of their right hands, followed by two slaps with the back of their hands, and then Swift pulled Brittany Mahomes toward her for a finishing move.
A new BFF handshake was officially born, although it looked like the two had put in some practice beforehand so they could nail it when it came time during the game.
Swift and Mahomes were also seen cheering together at other parts of the win over the Chargers. Mahomes was often holding one of her children with the QB.
Mahomes and Swift also seem to have ties that go beyond that gesture. TikToker and gemstone wholesaler Julia Hackman Chafé observed that the two appeared to be wearing matching jewelry at the game.

Chafé identified Swift wearing the necklace from Cartier's Juste un Clou collection. Mahomes appeared to have a bracelet from the same collection. Both the necklace and bracelet look to be shaped like a nail, the Juste un Clou's signature look.

In addition to the Cartier piece, the pop megastar added another new layer on Oct. 22, 2023, by wearing one of her signature friendship bracelets that featured a heart and the No. 87, which is Kelce’s jersey number.
Nov. 4, 2023: Brittany Mahomes joins Taylor Swift for a night out with Selena Gomez, Gigi Hadid and more
Flanked by longtime friend Selena Gomez and new friend Brittany Mahomes, Swift led the way out of a restaurant in November 2023, where photographers captured images.
In the pictures, Swift held their hands. Sophie Turner and Gigi Hadid hung back, a few steps behind.
Nov. 5, 2023: Brittany Mahomes is pictured leaving Taylor Swift's house
Several wives of Kansas City Chiefs players, including Brittany Mahomes, were photographed leaving Swift's New York home on Nov. 5, 2023, the same day the Chiefs played the Miami Dolphins in Germany.
Seeming to confirm the gathering, Mahomes posted a photo of her with Swift, Paige Buechele and Lyndsay Bell.
Dec. 3, 2023: Taylor Swift seemed to wear the same red coat Brittany Mahomes wore a year prior
At the Chiefs matchup against the Green Bay Packers on Dec. 3, 2023, Swift donned a long red teddy coat with an all-black ensemble and gold jewelry to cheer on Kelce.
On social media, fans speculated as to whether Swift borrowed the statement piece from Mahomes, as the quarterback's wife was seen wearing the jacket in 2022.
Dec. 5, 2023: Brittany Mahomes shares a new pic of her posing with Taylor Swift and Lyndsay Bell
It seemed Swift wasn't the only one who shares Mahomes' taste in big red coats.
In pics Mahomes posted Dec. 5, 2023, on Instagram, Swift and Bell sported matching red coats as they posed alongside Mahomes.
Jan. 6, 2024: Taylor Swift, Brittany Mahomes and Lyndsay Bell grab dinner together in LA
Swift and Mahomes spent the night before the singer’s expected appearance at the 2024 Golden Globe Awards grabbing dinner together in Los Angeles.
Multiple Swiftie update accounts shared photos on X of the pop icon and Mahomes leaving a restaurant together Jan. 6, 2024. Bell also joined them.

In the pictures, Swift stunned in a black minidress and over-the-knee boots. Mahomes wore a black blouse, gray miniskirt and knee-high boots, and Bell braved the chilly LA night in a white turtleneck sweater dress, leather jacket and black boots.

Their night out came ahead of the Golden Globes and the Chiefs game against the Los Angeles Chargers on Jan. 7, 2024. Swift’s concert film, “Taylor Swift: The Eras Tour,” was nominated for cinematic and box office achievement at the awards show.
Swift missed the Chiefs-Chargers game, which kicked off at 4:25 p.m. ET. Patrick Mahomes and Kelce did not take the field during the game and instead rested ahead of their playoff run.
Jan. 13, 2024: Brittany Mahomes and Taylor Swift twin at frigid Chiefs-Dolphins game
Swift and Brittany Mahomes took their friendship to the next level with matching outfits on Jan. 13 to kick off the 2024 postseason.
The pair attended the Chiefs-Dolphins playoff game on Jan. 13, 2024, in custom puffer jackets designed by Kristin Juszczyk, the wife of San Francisco 49ers fullback Kyle Juszczyk.
Mahomes shared the sporty photos of the duo Jan. 14, 2024, showing off their matching jackets and white hats.
“Twinning & Winning💯,” she captioned the pics.
Both jackets were bright red and warm for the frigid -4 degree-temperature at Arrowhead Stadium.
Swift’s jacket featured a giant 87 on the front and back of the outerwear. Mahomes’ jacket featured a 15, Patrick Mahomes’ number.
Kristin Juszczyk shared a video to Instagram documenting the design process, adding in the caption, “An honor of a lifetime!!!!! Thank you @taylorswift & @brittanylynne.”
Brittany Mahomes responded, “We love you and are so thankful.”
Jan. 28, 2024: Taylor Swift, Brittany Mahomes and Lyndsay Bell celebrate Chiefs AFC win
The two pals celebrated the Chiefs’ 17-10 win over the Ravens on Jan. 28, 2024, by posing in matching black Chiefs AFC Champions hats.
“LVIII,” Mahomes captioned the series of pics on Instagram on Jan. 30, referring to the roman numeral of the 2024 Super Bowl.
In addition to posting pics of their matching hats, Mahomes also shared a cute photo of herself and Swift touching Bell's pregnant belly.
Bell sported a huge grin as Swift took a drink and Mahomes smiled from ear to ear.
Feb. 2, 2024: Brittany Mahomes comes to Taylor Swift's defense
Mahomes came to to Swift's defense following critics who said the singer's presence draws attention away from games.
In a Feb. 2, 2024, Instagram story, she shared a Yahoo Sports post that quoted former NBA player-turned-sports-commentator Charles Barkley.
“If you’re screaming at Taylor Swift saying she ruined (football), you’re just a loser,” the quote from Barkley read.
Under the post, Mahomes wrote three simple words: “Let. Them. Know.”
Feb. 11, 2024: Brittany Mahomes and Taylor Swift pose arm-in-arm after Super Bowl victory

Swift and Mahomes celebrated the Chiefs’ victory at the Super Bowl Feb. 11, 2024 — the team's second championship victory in a row. They watched the nail-biter side by side (at one point, Swift literally bit her nails).
After the game at Allegiant Stadium, Swift and Mahomes were seen going to Wynn Las Vegas accompanied by Kelce and Patrick Mahomes.
The two posed for a picture together at the nightclub. Both were all smiles. Swift was also captured dancing with Kelce to her songs “Love Story” and “You Belong With Me.”
July 6, 2024: Brittany and Patrick Mahomes attend the 'Eras Tour'
Patrick and Brittany Mahomes were seen with Kelce at one of Swift’s concerts in Amsterdam July 6, 2024.
In a fan video shared on X, Brittany and Patrick Mahomes stood next to Kelce in a suite at Johan Cruijff Arena as they all swayed to the song “Lover.”

Brittany Mahomes also shared a clip of Swift performing her song “22” onstage, followed by a second video of the singer performing “Blank Space." For the event, the NFL wife was all bejeweled and wore a sparkling black top.
She later shared an Instagram slideshow on July 15, 2024, showcasing pictures from the European trip. Included in the post were photos of both couples.
The foursome were seen together on a balcony of sorts in one photo while in another, Swift had her arm around Brittany Mahomes and kissed her head.
Sept. 8, 2024: Taylor Swift and Brittany Mahomes have a double date at the US Open
Swift and Kelce had a whirlwind NYC weekend in September 2024, and they capped it off with a trip to the U.S. Open championship match. They attended the match alongside Patrick and Brittany Mahomes.
The group was photographed watching the match together and having fun hanging out, complete with a sweet hug between Swift and Brittany Mahomes.
Dec. 18, 2024: Brittany Mahomes shares pictures from 'Eras Tour'-themed party for Taylor Swift
After Swift wrapped her "Eras Tour" in December 2024, her boyfriend reportedly threw her an extravagant party to celebrate the record-breaking feat.

Brittany and Patrick Mahomes attended the event and shared a sneak peek at the festivities to Instagram. While Brittany Mahomes wore a sequined minidress that seemed to channel Swift's "Midnights" or "Fearless" eras, her husband wore a black suit, top hat and bow tie that clearly referenced Swift's performance of "I Can Do It With A Broken Heart."
Jan. 26, 2025: Taylor Swift and Brittany Mahomes celebrate the Chiefs making it to the Super Bowl (again)

After the Chiefs again won the AFC championship game in January, Swift and Mahomes celebrated their team's victory on the field. In addition to sweet moments with their loves, the friends also shared a hug on the field.
The Chiefs will return to the Super Bowl on Feb. 9, facing the Philadelphia Eagles in a rematch of the 2023 championship game.

title: What happens at the end of 'Sweet Magnolias' Season 4?
summary: Season 4 of "Sweet Magnolias" is action-packed from beginning to end. Read on for how the fourth season of the Netflix show ended.
story: Season 4 of "Sweet Magnolias" is action-packed from beginning to end.
The latest season of the Netflix show features a surprise wedding, the sudden death of a main character and a tempting job offer that could shake up the whole future of the show.
In other words, it was well worth the almost 19-month wait since Season 3.
What happens in Season 4 of 'Sweet Magnolias'?
Early on in Season 4, Maddie (JoAnna Garcia Swisher) and Cal (Justin Bruening) shock their friends when they stage a surprise wedding at their Halloween party.

The season takes a bit of a somber turn when Maddie's ex-husband Bill (Chris Klein) suddenly dies, leaving his children with a lot of mixed feelings since they didn't have the best relationship with him.
Throughout the season, Maddie and her besties Helen (Heather Headley) and Dana Sue (Brooke Elliott) gather together to "pour it out" during their regular girls' nights as life takes twists and turns.
Read on for what happens at the end of "Sweet Magnolias" Season 4.
Maddie decides to take a job in New York City

Over the last few seasons, Maddie has been laser-focused on the local spa she runs with her two BFFs. This season, she gets the chance to put her marketing degree to use when she serves as a makeshift town spokesperson during some TV news interviews.

Soon enough, an independent book publishing house takes notice of the interviews and reaches out to Maddie asking if she'd be interested in working on their marketing team. The only caveat? The company is located in New York City and would require Maddie to relocate.

Since she recently married Cal and her children are embedded in the Serenity community, Maddie consults her family to see how they feel about the potential move. Everyone is supportive and encourages her to follow her passion.
When Maddie tells Helen and Dana Sue, they're shocked and a bit sad, but excited for her. Helen even helps Maddie negotiate her salary before she accepts the job offer.
Erik proposes to Helen

For years, "Sweet Magnolias" viewers have been waiting for Erik (Dion Johnstone) and Helen to get their happy ending. After plenty of bumps along the road, they reunite in Season 4 and get engaged in the season finale.

With the help of Helen's mother, Erik plans a surprise proposal and Helen gladly accepts. She skips wearing her ring to Christmas Eve service so she doesn't upstage the mass, but later shares the exciting news with her friends at their Christmas celebration.
Dana Sue and Ronnie explore a new business

Life has been sweet for Dana Sue and Ronnie (Brandon Quinn) since their wedding last season. Ronnie and his buddies have taken over his wife's restaurant, leaving her to focus on some passion projects. But Dana Sue worries that her husband is undergoing a midlife crisis when he starts acting a bit rebellious and impulsively buys a motorcycle.

When Ronnie starts talking about launching a new business involving guided road tours on e-bikes, Dana Sue has reservations. In the season finale, they make a connection to a potential investor and both seem optimistic about the future.
Noreen's professional and personal life blossoms

When a dangerous storm hits Serenity, many members of the town step up to help residents in need of support, including Noreen (Jamie Lynn Spears), who has a background in nursing. Alongside local health professional Howie (Shawn Passwaters), Noreen starts conducting house calls on residents.

The pair is inspired to expand their services and take the first steps to open a mobile clinic. Noreen still plans to work part time at the spa, but will now have more time to devote to her passion for medicine.
In her personal life, Noreen's romance with Jeremy (Chase Anderson) also evolves as he invites her and her daughter to move in with him.
Isaac finds a new love interest

When one of Isaac’s (Chris Medlin) former classmates shows up in town to work on emergency services following a big storm, he’s taken aback. The two never got along particularly but suddenly, there’s a vibe between them.
After some awkward moments, flirting ensues and the pair finally decide to go on a date. At a holiday event in the season finale, things heat up when they share their first kiss.
Annie gets accepted into an art school

For years, Annie (Anneliese Judge) has been honing her talent for photography and her hard work gets rewarded when she’s accepted to an art college in California. Although Dana Sue is initially worried about the tuition expenses and the distance, she tells her daughter she’s proud of her and says they will “find a way” to make it work.
Trouble is brewing for Annie and Ty
Ty (Carson Rowland) and Annie finally start dating this season. However, they spend more time apart than together when Ty leaves town to pursue a music career.
When he returns home before Christmas, Ty brings news that he will be going on tour in Europe that summer and into the fall.

Annie is heading off to school in the fall, but Ty asks her to defer her college journey by a semester so she can join him on tour. Neither of them are willing to give up on their dreams and they appear to be at an impasse.
An upset Annie then walks away after saying, "You took 17 years to tell me you love me. If we can't last one more, maybe that's our answer."
Pastor June goes into labor

While delivering her sermon at Christmas Eve mass, a very pregnant Pastor June (Tracey Bonner) interrupts the service when she experiences contractions. She’s hesitant to leave her congregation in the middle of such an important day, but Helen and Erik convince her that she needs to get to the hospital right away.
Helen takes over to sing a beautiful rendition of “O Come, All Ye Faithful” and Pastor June later gives birth to a healthy, beautiful baby.
Kyle and Lily’s relationship woes subside

Kyle (Logan Allen) and Lily (Artemis) are enjoying each other’s company now that they’re officially dating. But when a new male member of their friend group monopolizes all of Kyle’s time, Lily grows frustrated. Kyle later tells his new friend they need to spend less time together so he has more time for his girlfriend.

In the season finale, Kyle attempts to make a grand romantic gesture to make up for lost time with Lily but she tells him she just wants things to go back to normal. He understands and they share a sweet moment together at a local holiday event.

Whether it’s ticking off favorite award show outfits, reciting the setlist of your first concert, or singing songs lyric-by-lyric among crowds of 70,000 proud concertgoers, it's clear that Swifties take their fandom very seriously.

Now, with Taylor's record-breaking Eras Tour behind her, fans are excited as ever to see what the singer and songwriter has up her sleeve. But before you blast your vinyl, pair up with a fellow Swift aficionado and see how well you do on these trivia questions.

Be fearless and see how many you get right. (And if you can’t come up with the correct answers to them all, don’t sweat it — a recent “Jeopardy” contestant flubbed a Taylor Swift question, so you're in good company.)

title: Irv Gotti, co-founder of Murder Inc. Records, dies at 54
summary: Irv Gotti, music producer and co-founder of Murder Inc., has died at 54. He was known for making hit songs with Ashanti and Ja Rule in the 2000s.
story: Irv Gotti, music producer and co-founder of Murder Inc. Records who helped launch the careers of artists like Ja Rule and Ashanti, has died on Feb. 5, according to his family. He was 54.
Gotti's three kids, Angie, Sonny and JJ, released a joint statement about his death on Instagram.
It said, "Surrounded by family and friends, he departed this world, leaving behind a legacy that will forever resonate in the hearts of those who knew him and the countless lives he touched."

"Our dad was an incredible man, a true visionary who transformed the hip-hop industry and changed the game for artists and fans alike," the statement continued. "His passion for music and dedication to his craft inspired many, and his contributions will continue to influence future generations."
The family asked for privacy as they grieved the loss of their "dad, son, brother, uncle, and friend."

"We take comfort in knowing that his spirit will live on through his music and the love he shared with all of us. Thank you for your understanding and support during this challenging time," the statement concluded.
Def Jam Recordings, the parent company of Gotti's Murder Inc. Records, also shared the news of his passing in a statement posted to Instagram Jan. 5, saying they are "deeply saddened at the loss."

“His contributions at Def Jam, as both an A&R executive and in partnership with Murder. Inc., helped pave the way for the next generation of artists and producers, a force that reshaped the soundscape of hip hop and R&B," the statement read.

"His creative genius and unwavering dedication to the culture birthed countless hits, defining an era of music that continues to resonate with fans worldwide," it continued. "Our thoughts are with his family, friends, and all those who were touched by his work."
A cause of death was not provided in the statement.

Born Irving Domingo Lorenzo Jr. on June 26, 1970, Irv Gotti was instrumental in the careers of many music artists, including talent like Ashanti and Ja Rule and hip-hop stars like Jay-Z and the late DMX.

Aside from co-founding Murder Inc. Records, Gotti was an A&R executive at Def Jam and was involved with hit records like "Always On Time" and Jennifer Lopez's "Ain’t It Funny." He also made a name for himself working on the soundtrack of 1998's "Rush Hour," 2001's "Fast and the Furious" and the 2000 movie "Romeo Must Die" starring Jet Li and the late Aaliyah.

Gotti's health has been a topic of discussion for the past couple of years. During an Aug. 2023 interview on Revolt TV’s "Drink Champs" podcast, the music producer spoke openly about what it's like to live with diabetes and his struggle to manage the chronic disease.
“I’ve been diagnosed with diabetes forever. It’s hereditary,” Gotti said, before noting that he didn't like to restrict himself when it came to his diet.
“You know what’s f—ed up with diabetes? So anything that you’re going to like or taste good — horrible for you,” he said.
“This is why my kids get mad because I’m telling them, ‘Yo, I’m going to live.’ Like, ya’ll motherf—---- want me to die and not enjoy life. I’m going to enjoy life and do certain s—," Gotti added.

title: Christina Haack goes Instagram official with businessman boyfriend
summary: Christina Haack just had a relationship debut. She premiered her new boyfriend Christopher Larocca on Instagram. Who is Christopher Larocca?
story: Christina Haack is ready to introduce her new man to the world.
The HGTV star took to Instagram on Feb. 5 to share photos from a recent trip and paired a cheeky caption with two photos of her new beau.
“Some plane flights must be hard posted. 🛩️ 🐉,” she captioned the post, alluding to the hard launch of her new relationship.

In the first photo, Haack gazes out of an airplane window while holding a drink in her hand. The next photo shows the 41-year-old cozying up to a mystery man and sitting partially on his lap on the plane.
Haack tagged her new man, whose name is Christopher Larocca, in the post and shared another photo of them posing in front of a private jet.
TODAY.com has reached out to Haack’s representative for comment.
Who is Christopher Larocca?
Larocca’s Instagram page is private, but Haack is one of his 200 followers.
Per his LinkedIn profile, he's based in California and works as the president and chief executive officer of Network Connex, a communications infrastructure company.

Larocca’s Network Connex biography notes that he has 20 years of experience leading companies and was previously the president and CEO of Nortek Control, a company focused on “artificial intelligence, facial recognition, smart connected systems for security and home automation, access control, and digital health markets.”
Elsewhere during his career, Larocca was a CEO or a member of the executive management team at several companies, including Dover Corporation, General Electric and Luminance Brands.
Larocca has an MBA from the University of Southern California and a BS in structural engineering from Clemson University, per his LinkedIn.
What is Haack's relationship history?
Haack's husband of three years, Josh Hall, filed for divorce in July 2024, citing “irreconcilable differences," according to court documents obtained by TODAY.com.
Before Hall, Haack was married to TV host Ant Anstead between 2018 and 2020. The former couple welcomed a son named Hudson in 2019.

Haack married her first husband, Tarek El Moussa, in 2009. The couple announced their split in 2016 then finalized their divorce in 2018. They share two children: a daughter named Taylor and a son named Brayden.
In 2021, El Moussa married Heather Rae El Moussa and the couple welcomed a son named Tristan in 2023.

Haack and Hall's breakup is captured in the new show "The Flip Off." The two entered the show a team competing against Heather and Tarek El Moussa, though Haack ended up moving forward in the competition without him.

title: Trump's Gaza comments hand jihadist terrorists a 'rallying cry,' experts say
summary: President Trump’s talk of a “take over” of Gaza threatens to fuel an already rising terrorist threat against the United States, ex-intelligence officials say.
story: President Donald Trump’s calls for the United States to “take over” and “develop” the Gaza Strip have handed jihadist terrorist groups a rallying cry to recruit and inspire attacks against Americans at home and abroad, security experts and former intelligence officials say.

Trump’s comments this week, proposing that the United States would control the Palestinian enclave while its residents would be forced to relocate abroad, have caused shock and outrage around the world — and terrorists will pounce on that anger to attract more support and organize attacks, experts said.

“I think every CIA station chief in the Middle East woke up this morning with a migraine headache, because there’s a potential for a generational counterterrorism nightmare here,” Marc Polymeropoulos, a former CIA officer who worked in the region, said Wednesday in an interview on MSNBC's "Morning Joe."
Polymeropoulos highlighted the language Trump has used in recent days — that the United States would "take over" and "own" Gaza.
“These are triggering mechanisms for Islamic extremist groups,” he said, adding, “This kind of language only is going to galvanize groups that want to kill Americans."
U.S. law enforcement and intelligence officials have repeatedly warned in recent months of a heightened global terrorist threat, mainly due to the fallout from the 15-month Israel-Hamas war in Gaza.

Israel launched an invasion of Gaza after Hamas militants staged a surprise attack on Israel on Oct. 7, 2023, killing 1,200 people, most of them civilians. More than 46,000 Palestinians have been killed in the fighting in the enclave, according to Gaza’s Health Ministry.

The Islamic State and other jihadist extremists have seized on the Gaza conflict and the suffering of Palestinian civilians as material for propaganda and to encourage attacks on governments painted as enemies of Muslims, said Lucas Webber, senior threat analyst at Tech Against Terrorists, a nonprofit organization.

“This most recent development will hypercharge these existing trends and provide fodder for the Islamic State to tap into it and leverage it to build support, empower its rhetoric, recruit and even incite violence,” Webber said.

Pro-ISIS propagandists have already started to highlight Trump’s comments on social media, portraying his language as a vindication of their labeling the United States as an enemy of Muslims, according to Webber.
Sen. Chris Murphy, D-Conn., called Trump’s remarks “literally bulletin board recruiting material today for our terrorist enemies, whether or not we ever go into Gaza.”

“The idea that we’re going to clear Gaza out of Palestinians, that drives young men to extremist groups, to violence, to groups that are based around violence,” Murphy, a member of the Foreign Relations Committee, said Wednesday in an interview on MSNBC's "Morning Joe."

The White House has defended Trump’s comments, saying he has shown a willingness to question conventional wisdom about the Middle East and scored a breakthrough in his first term by securing an agreement between Israel and four Arab countries to establish diplomatic ties.

Brian Hughes, spokesman for the White House National Security Council, said the same lawmakers and former officials now criticizing the president once “claimed the Middle East would devolve into violence after President Trump moved the U.S. embassy in Israel to Jerusalem or recognized the Israel’s sovereignty over the Golan Heights.”

“The truth is President Trump is the only president to broker a peace agreement between four Muslim-majority countries and Israel," Brian Hughes, a spokesperson for the White House National Security Council, said in an email. "He’s the only modern-day president to have a record of success in the Middle East."

Both Murphy and Polymeropoulos previously sharply criticized Trump’s decision in his first term to move the American embassy to Jerusalem, warning of possible violence or potential damage to relations with Arab allies.
Trump has defended his remarks on Gaza and renewed his calls for a U.S. takeover, though he said Thursday it would not involve American boots on the ground.

In past decades, suicide terrorist attacks have spiked in response to the U.S. or other foreign militaries’ occupying, or being perceived to be occupying, territory that terrorists see as their homeland, according to research by Robert Pape, a professor of international relations at the University of Chicago.

The 2003 U.S. invasion of Iraq and the subsequent occupation touched off “the largest suicide terrorist campaign in modern times,” said Pape, who has compiled a database of thousands of suicide attacks worldwide.
As the United States has scaled back its military footprint in the Middle East, the relative terrorist threat against it has receded since the U.S. war in Iraq, he said.
But Trump’s vow to exert U.S. authority over Gaza gives groups like ISIS a major boost and puts Americans in the crosshairs, Pape said.
“It’s really been quite some time since they’ve had this shot of energy,” he said. “A group like Al Qaeda has been desperate for something like this.”
Jihadist militants will most likely try to organize terrorist attacks against U.S. targets to signal to Washington that they will not tolerate a possible U.S. occupation, he said.
“They will start attacking Americans to deter us from starting down this road again,” Pape said.

Christopher O’Leary, a former senior FBI official who worked on counterterrorism cases, said Trump’s language could prompt Palestinian militants to focus on targeting Americans abroad and possibly inside the United States, something not seen since the 1970s and ’80s.
And jihadist extremists will seize on his words to stoke anger and paint a picture of the United States as a foreign occupier, he said.

“Global jihadist groups will also use a narrative of the United States occupying Arab lands as a rallying cry for new recruits,” said O’Leary, senior vice president at the Soufan Group, a global security consultancy.

O’Leary and other former government officials said Trump’s statements were especially worrying as they coincide with a time of uncertainty and upheaval at U.S. law enforcement and intelligence agencies.

In recent days the Trump administration has launched a review of the conduct of FBI agents who worked on cases related to the Jan. 6, 2021, attacks on the Capitol, and it is seeking to drastically reduce the federal workforce by offering so-called buyouts to employees at the FBI, the CIA and elsewhere.
“The addition of the Gaza announcement coupled with the erosion of our security services could really elevate the terrorist threat,” O’Leary said.

Trump’s proposal to take control of Gaza — and potentially expel the roughly 2.2 million Palestinians living there — has sparked fury and confusion in the Middle East and around the world. Many foreign government officials, regional analysts and human rights groups say his plan amounts to ethnic cleansing.
Secretary of State Marco Rubio and White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt sought to play down and walk back his comments Wednesday.
But Trump doubled down Thursday, defending his proposal and saying the United States could take over Gaza without needing to send U.S. troops.

Trump said on Truth Social that Palestinians could be “resettled in far safer and more beautiful communities, with new and modern homes, in the region.” His contradictory comments added fresh confusion about the future of Palestinians in Gaza.

Even if Trump renounces his comments or never follows through on his ideas about U.S. control of Gaza, jihadist militants now believe the United States — which has already invaded one Muslim country in the Middle East — has its sights set on the Gaza Strip, Pape and other analysts said.
The damage has been done, Pape said. “We’re not getting ourselves out of this by somehow spinning the facts.”

title: Hamas names hostages to be freed after accusing Israel of breaching ceasefire
summary: Hamas announced the names of three Israeli hostages to be released on Saturday in exchange for 183 Palestinian prisoners and detainees.
story: Hamas on Friday announced the names of three Israeli hostages to be released on Saturday in exchange for 183 Palestinian prisoners and detainees after a delay that underlined the obstacles hanging over a fragile deal meant to end the war in Gaza.

Ohad Ben Ami and Eli Sharabi, both taken hostage from Kibbutz Be’eri during the cross-border Hamas-led attack on Oct 7, 2023, and Or Levy, abducted that day from the Nova music festival, will be handed over on Saturday, Hamas said.

The Hamas prisoners’ media office said Israel was expected to free 183 Palestinians in exchange, including 18 who have been serving life sentences, 54 serving long sentences and 111 who were detained in the Gaza Strip during the war.

Earlier the Palestinian militant group accused Israel of breaching their ceasefire accord and held off announcing the names of the three Israelis until a 4 p.m. local time (11 a.m. ET) deadline had passed. It was not immediately clear whether the delay would affect the scheduled exchange on Saturday.

Hamas accused Israel of delaying the entry of hundreds of trucks carrying food and other humanitarian supplies agreed under the truce deal that took effect on January 19, and holding back all but a fraction of the tents and mobile homes needed to provide shelter to people returning to their bombed-out homes.
“This demonstrates clear manipulation of relief and shelter priorities,” Hamas said in a statement.
COGAT, the Israeli military agency that is overseeing the aid deliveries into Gaza, denied the accusation and warned that Israel would “not tolerate violations by Hamas.”

The spat compounds the uncertainty around the ceasefire that had already mounted following U.S. President Donald Trump’s surprise announcement this week that he expected Gaza to be taken over by the United States.

Trump said on Tuesday he wanted to move the population of Gaza to a third country like Egypt or Jordan and place the small coastal enclave under U.S. control to be developed into the “Riviera of the Middle East”.
The statement underlined the fragility of the deal reached last month with Egyptian and Qatari mediators and backed by the United States.
